title: volume-set-space
description:
CHANGE VOLUME SPACE INFORMATION.

Writes a copy of the volume file, with the spacing information changed as specified.  No reordering of the voxel data occurs, see -volume-reorient to change the volume indexing order and reorder the voxels to match.  Exactly one of -plumb, -sform, or -file must be specified.

axis-order.description: a string like 'XYZ' that specifies which index is along which spatial dimension

x-spacing.description: change in x-coordinate from incrementing the relevant index

y-spacing.description: change in y-coordinate from incrementing the relevant index

z-spacing.description: change in z-coordinate from incrementing the relevant index

x-offset.description: the x-coordinate of the first voxel

y-offset.description: the y-coordinate of the first voxel

z-offset.description: the z-coordinate of the first voxel

anyOf.description: set via axis order and spacing/offset

plumb.description: set via axis order and spacing/offset

xi-spacing.description: increase in x coordinate from incrementing the i index

xj-spacing.description: increase in x coordinate from incrementing the j index

xk-spacing.description: increase in x coordinate from incrementing the k index

yi-spacing.description: increase in y coordinate from incrementing the i index

yj-spacing.description: increase in y coordinate from incrementing the j index

yk-spacing.description: increase in y coordinate from incrementing the k index

zi-spacing.description: increase in z coordinate from incrementing the i index

zj-spacing.description: increase in z coordinate from incrementing the j index

zk-spacing.description: increase in z coordinate from incrementing the k index

volume-ref.description: volume file to use for reference space

ignore-dims.description: copy the spacing info even if the dimensions don't match

anyOf.description: copy spacing info from volume file with matching dimensions

file.description: copy spacing info from volume file with matching dimensions
